intro: Moussonia skutchii, commonly known as the Skutch's moussonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
